excerpt: A steep gondola ride to a park with views of Beppu city & leafy hiking trails atop Mount Tsurumi.
detail_description: Ascend to the heights of Mount Tsurumi on the Beppu Ropeway, a thrilling gondola ride that offers breathtaking views of Beppu city, Beppu Bay, Oita City, and Mount Yufu. The 1375-meter mountain is a sight to behold throughout the year, with snow in winter, lush greenery in spring, vibrant azalea blooms in summer, and stunning autumn colors.
name: Beppu Ropeway
address: Japan, 〒874-0000 Oita, Beppu, Minamitateishi, 字寒原１０−７

excerpt: Small park centered on a cobalt-blue geothermal pool cloaked in vapors, with a footbath & cafe.
detail_description: Umi Jigoku, also known as Sea Hell, is one of the eight Beppu Hells in Japan. This geothermal pool was formed 1,200 years ago when Tsurumi Volcano erupted and is the largest hot spring among the group. The cobalt-blue water of Umi Jigoku looks magical and reaches temperatures around 98 degrees Celsius. Visitors can admire the vapors cloaking the pool while enjoying a footbath or visiting the nearby cafe.
name: Umi Jigoku

excerpt: Built 1956–1957, the 100-m. tower offers an observation platform at 55 m. & a gift shop.
detail_description: Beppu Tower, completed in 1957, stands at 100 meters tall and features an observation platform at 55 meters as well as a gift shop. It is a symbol of Japan's post-war optimism and revival, designed by architect Chuta Naito. The property is conveniently located near Oita airport and cultural venues like the Oita Fragrance Interactive Museum. Additionally, it is within close proximity to natural attractions such as Takasakiyama Mountain and Kamado Jigoku.
name: Beppu Tower
address: 別府タワ, 3 Chome-10-2 Kitahama, Beppu, Oita 874-0920, Japan

excerpt: Beppu is a city and spa resort on the southern Japanese island of Kyushu. Set between Beppu Bay and volcanic mountains, it's home to more than 2,000 onsen (hot springs). Kannawa Onsen district has facilities for bathing in nutrient-rich water, mud and sand. The 8 Hells of Beppu—6 in Kannawa, 2 in outlying Shibaseki—are dramatic landscapes of thermal pools. To the west is Mount Tsurumi, accessible by cable car.
detail_description: Beppu, a city and spa resort in Kyushu, Japan, is famous for its 2,000 hot springs. The Kannawa Onsen district offers bathing in nutrient-rich water, mud, and sand while the 8 Hells of Beppu are dramatic thermal pool landscapes. Visitors can choose from various hot spring experiences including public baths or luxury Ryokan. Additionally, the area boasts attractions such as Mount Tsurumi and is near other gourmet destinations.
name: Beppu

excerpt: Geyser that erupts every 30 minutes, with an observation area, spring blossoms & a souvenir shop.
detail_description: Tatsumaki Jigoku, also known as Tornado Hell, is a unique geyser located in Beppu. Unlike the other hells in the area, Tatsumaki Jigoku erupts at regular intervals of about 30-40 minutes and can reach an impressive height of 20 meters. Visitors can witness this natural phenomenon from a designated observation area and marvel at the powerful eruptions.
name: Tatsumaki Jigoku

excerpt: Amusement park offering the country's first wooden roller coaster & a seasonal outdoor skating rink.
detail_description: Kijima Kogen Park is a unique amusement park that boasts Japan's first wooden roller coaster and a seasonal outdoor skating rink. It offers an array of attractions suitable for families and thrill-seekers alike, including slides, swings, and thrilling rides with varying heights to cater to different preferences. The park's standout feature is Jupiter, the country's inaugural wooden roller coaster. Visitors can also enjoy leisurely activities such as riding the Ferris wheel for a more relaxed experience.
name: Kijima Kogen Park
address: Japan, 〒874-8666 Oita, Beppu, 城島高原１２３

excerpt: Hell-themed geothermal park with steaming red & blue pools, plus a footbath, gift shop & snacks.
detail_description: Kamado Jigoku is a geothermal park in Beppu, featuring steaming red and blue pools, a footbath, gift shop, and snacks. It's conveniently located near public transportation and offers day-use hot spring bathing facilities with salt springs known for their moisturizing properties. The park showcases various uses of geothermal energy in the city, including boiling water for tea preparation and floor heating using underground steam.
name: Kamado Jigoku

excerpt: Strolls amid colorful flower beds, a bamboo grove & pine trees, plus spring cherry & plum blossoms.
detail_description: Beppu Park is a serene and expansive public green space in the heart of the city, offering a peaceful escape amidst nature. The park features traditional Japanese garden elements such as ponds, bridges, and beautifully manicured landscapes, making it an ideal spot for a leisurely stroll or a relaxing picnic. Visitors can enjoy the vibrant displays of cherry blossoms and plum blossoms during their respective blooming seasons.
name: Beppu Park

excerpt: Steaming thermal pool with dark-red water naturally colored by iron oxide & nearby foot baths
detail_description: Chinoike Jigoku, also known as Blood Pond Hell, is a striking thermal pool with dark-red water naturally colored by iron oxide. It is part of the popular Hell Tour which includes visits to various other hells like Sea Hell, Oni Rock Monk Hell, White Pond Hell, and more. The tour ticket allows access to all these sites and offers the opportunity to try out hot foot baths.
name: Chinoike Jigoku

excerpt: Large bayside marine-life park & aquarium with dolphin & walrus shows & interactive programs.
detail_description: Immerse yourself in the enchanting world of marine life at Oita Marine Palace Aquarium "Umitamago". This bayside park offers captivating dolphin and walrus shows, as well as interactive programs that allow visitors to get up close with these fascinating sea creatures. The highlight of the aquarium is a massive 1,250-ton circular water tank showcasing 90 different species of fish native to the nearby Bungo Channel.
name: Oita Marine Palace Aquarium "Umitamago"
address: 字ウト-3078番地の22 Kanzaki, Oita, 870-0100, Japan

excerpt: Interactive museum featuring exotic & historic fragrance exhibits & a make-your-own-scent workshop.
detail_description: Oita Fragrance Museum is an interactive museum located in Beppu, offering a unique experience with exotic and historic fragrance exhibits. Visitors can also participate in a make-your-own-scent workshop. The museum is conveniently situated within close proximity to various cultural venues and natural attractions, making it an ideal stop for travelers exploring the area. Additionally, guests can enjoy accommodation at the nearby Beppu Nagomitsuki, which provides comfortable lodging with amenities such as open-air baths and free Wi-Fi.
name: Oita Fragrance Museum

excerpt: Ancient site featuring a hot spring with gray, hot, bubbling mud said to resemble a monk's head.
detail_description: Oniishi Bozu Jigoku is a historic and popular sightseeing destination in Beppu, known for its hot spring with gray, bubbling mud that resembles a monk's head. The site is mentioned in a regional historical chronicle from 733 and offers day-use hot spring bathing facilities. The salt spring waters are believed to be highly moisturizing and beneficial for treating nerve pain, muscle soreness, and chronic digestive diseases.
name: Oniishi Bozu Jigoku

detail_description: The Beppu City Traditional Bamboo Crafts Center is a must-visit destination for those interested in the art of bamboo crafts. Located in Beppu, this museum showcases the rich history and versatility of bamboo, a material deeply ingrained in Japanese daily life. Visitors can explore exhibits that detail the growth of bamboo, its various types, and its significance in traditional Japanese culture.
name: 別府市竹細工伝統産業会館 Beppu City Traditional Bamboo Crafts Center

excerpt: Popular hot springs attraction featuring fenced pools with kitschy themes & animal enclosures.
detail_description: Beppu 'Jigoku Meguri' Hells Tour is a famous hot springs attraction with themed fenced pools and animal enclosures. The tour consists of two groups, one at Kannawa and the other further north. The Kannawa group includes unique hells like Umi Jigoku, Oniishibozu Jigoku, Shira-ike Jigoku, and Kamado Jigoku.
name: Hells of Beppu

excerpt: Popular outdoor center featuring young & adult crocodiles on display amid a range of hot springs.
detail_description: Oniyama Jigoku is a popular outdoor center located in Oniishi Bozu Jigoku, featuring young and adult crocodiles on display amidst a variety of hot springs. It's conveniently accessible from Umi Jigoku-mae bus stop and Kamegawa Station or Beppu Station.
name: Oniyama Jigoku

excerpt: Quaint natural attraction featuring a pluming hot spring, manicured traditional garden & aquarium.
detail_description: Shiraike Jigoku, also known as White Pond Hell, is a picturesque natural attraction located in Beppu, Japan. This charming spot features a pluming hot spring and a well-maintained traditional garden. Visitors can also explore an aquarium on the premises. The hot spring's salt water is believed to have moisturizing properties and therapeutic benefits for conditions like nerve pain, muscle soreness, and chronic digestive diseases.
name: Shiraike Jigoku

excerpt: Classic hot spring baths & a unique sand immersion bath offered in an old-fashioned building.
detail_description: Takegawara Onsen is a historic hot spring bath located in Oita, Japan. Established in 1879, this classic onsen features traditional wooden architecture with a striking karahafu gable design reminiscent of the Kamakura Era. Visitors can experience the unique sand immersion bath along with classic hot spring baths in an old-fashioned building. The onsen's profound atmosphere and high ceilings create a nostalgic ambiance, making it an iconic stop for anyone visiting Beppu.
name: Takegawara Onsen

excerpt: Onsen village spa in wooded hills, with thermal pools in timber huts & outdoors for family bathing.
detail_description: Myoban Yunosato Onsen is a historic onsen village nestled in the wooded hills of Beppu City, Japan. It is renowned for its unique yunohana mineral deposits that have been utilized in bathhouses for centuries. The village offers visitors a chance to witness the traditional harvesting of these minerals and indulge in bathing in mineral-rich hot springs. With picturesque thatched-roof buildings, Myoban Yunosato Onsen provides a glimpse into Japan's onsen heritage.
name: Myoban Yunosato Onsen

excerpt: Beppu Onsen is an extensive hot spring system in the city of Beppu, Ōita, Japan. There are eight distinct major thermal spring zones called "Beppu Hatto". Wikipedia.
detail_description: Beppu Onsen, located in Beppu, Ōita, Japan, is a vast hot spring complex consisting of eight major thermal spring zones known as 'Beppu Hatto'. This extensive and tattoo-friendly hot spring resort is made up of eight smaller villages spread throughout the city. Visitors can explore the town's famous hells hot springs, which are not for bathing but offer colorful and exotic views.
name: Beppu Onsen

excerpt: Volcanic mountain that can be ascended on foot or via a 10-minute cable-car ride.
detail_description: Mount Tsurumi, also known as Tsurumidake, is a 1375m high volcanic mountain in Beppu City. Visitors can ascend on foot or take a 10-minute cable-car ride to reach the small park near the summit. The park offers multiple observation decks with panoramic views of Beppu and Oita City, Mount Yufu, and even the Kuju Mountains on clear days. There are walking paths to explore mountain shrines and reach the actual summit.
name: Mount Tsurumi

excerpt: Mountaintop amusement park accessed by a cablecar, with rides, games, a pool & a variety of animals.
detail_description: Rakutenchi Amusement Park, established in 1929, is a mountaintop attraction in Beppu accessible by cable car. The park offers a range of activities including rides, games, and a small zoo. Visitors can also enjoy the summer water park and take in scenic views of Beppu Bay from the suspension bridge. The park is particularly famous for its Flower Ferris Wheel, the only double ferris wheel in Japan.
name: Beppu Cable Rakutenchi
address: 18丁目 流川通り, Beppu, Oita 874-0820, Japan

excerpt: Low-key spot for outdoor & indoor hot-spring baths, including private options, plus Japanese meals.
detail_description: Hyotan Onsen, located in the Kannawa area of Beppu, is a recently renovated day trip hot spring facility offering a variety of unique bathing experiences. This low-key spot features both outdoor and indoor hot-spring baths, including private options, as well as Japanese meals. The gender-segregated hot springs cater to guests with tattoos and offer a wide range of bathing styles such as sand baths, foot baths, waterfall baths, steam baths, and even family baths for private reservations.
name: Hyotan Onsen

detail_description: Kannawa Onsen is a charming hot spring town in Japan known for its therapeutic waters and traditional atmosphere. The area is famous for its unique 'jigoku meguri' or 'hell tour,' where visitors can explore various natural hot springs and geothermal features. The town offers a range of bathing facilities, including public baths and foot baths, allowing guests to relax and soak in the restorative waters.
name: Kannawa Onsen

excerpt: Landmark restaurant known for traditional "hell-steaming" of meat & vegetables over thermal springs.
detail_description: Jigokumushikobo Kannawa is a renowned restaurant in Beppu, offering the traditional "hell-steaming" method of cooking food using thermal spring steam. This unique style of cooking utilizes the natural heat from geothermal energy to steam a variety of ingredients such as meat, seafood, and vegetables. The restaurant is located near the Jigoku Meguri and is a popular choice for visitors looking to experience this ancient cooking technique.
name: Jigokumushikobo Kannawa
address: ５組 風呂本, Beppu, Oita 874-0041, Japan

detail_description: Global Tower, located near the B-Con Plaza convention center in Beppu, Japan, is a 125-meter tall architectural marvel designed by renowned architect Arata Isozaki. The futuristic design features two side pillars supporting a massive central arch-shaped structure. Visitors can enjoy panoramic views of Beppu City and its natural surroundings from the 100-meter high observation deck.
name: Global Tower

detail_description: Yufuincho Kawakami, a district within the city of Yufu in Ōita Prefecture, Japan, is situated at an elevation of around 400 meters. With a population of approximately 11,342 people and a density of 88.77 persons per km² as of 2003, it covers a total area of 127.77 km².
name: Yufuincho Kawakami

excerpt: Visitors lie in waterfront pits covered with hot sand said to have healing properties.
detail_description: Nestled along the picturesque Shoningahama coastline, Beppu Beach Sand Bath offers a unique and rejuvenating experience that combines the natural beauty of one of Beppu's few remaining sandy beaches with the therapeutic benefits of geothermal heat. Since its inception in 1986, this distinctive sand bath has allowed visitors to immerse themselves in warm sand pits, promoting relaxation and healing for various ailments like joint pain and digestive issues.
name: Beppu Beach Sand Bath

detail_description: Art enthusiasts and couples seeking a cultural experience will find the Beppu Art Museum to be a delightful attraction. Situated conveniently near Beppu Station, this museum offers a stunning collection of Japanese artworks, as well as pieces by renowned international artists like Picasso and Dali. Visitors can also appreciate local pottery and calligraphy. The museum's location along the beach adds to its charm, making it an ideal stop for art lovers exploring Beppu.
name: Beppu Art Museum
address: 別府タワ 2階, 3 Chome-10-2 Kitahama, Beppu, Oita 874-0920, Japan

detail_description: Nestled beneath the elevated Beppu Station, the Beppu Station Market is a delightful retro shopping arcade that serves as a culinary haven for locals and visitors alike. This vibrant marketplace is brimming with shops that cater to everyday needs, featuring everything from fresh vegetables and seafood to traditional Japanese sweets. The atmosphere buzzes with the enticing aromas of street food, making it an ideal spot for those looking to savor authentic flavors at reasonable prices.
name: Beppu Station Market

excerpt: Family-friendly animal park for viewing & interacting with monkeys in natural environs.
detail_description: Takasakiyama Natural Zoological Garden, also known as Beppus Monkey Park, is a nature reserve located near Oita City. The park is home to wild Japanese macaque monkeys who roam freely on the 628-meter-high Mount Takasaki. Established in 1952, the zoo was created to provide a safe haven for these playful monkeys and mitigate conflicts with local farmers.
name: Takasakiyama Natural Zoological Garden

excerpt: Cars drive through this safari-style park with many exotic animals, plus eateries & a gift shop.
detail_description: Kyushu Natural Animal Park African Safari, located between Beppu and Yufuin, offers a thrilling safari experience where visitors can drive through the vast park in secure jungle buses to see exotic animals like lions, tigers, giraffes, elephants, and more up close. The park also features interactive zones where guests can touch kangaroos and ride horses.
name: Kyushu Wildlife Park African Safari

detail_description: Hachiman Asami Shrine is a must-visit in Beppu, offering a serene and well-kept environment. The entrance with its two majestic trees sets the tone for a special experience. Visitors can obtain unique wood-bound Goshuincho here. During the New Year season, it becomes especially popular, offering lucky charms and fortunes for the year. The shrine also sells hot sake and coffee.
name: Hachiman Asami Shrine

detail_description: Located in Beppu, Oita Prefecture, Restaurant Toyoken is renowned for its toriten, a Japanese-style fried chicken dish that originated in the region. This popular snack consists of small pieces of chicken marinated in sake, garlic powder, and ginger, coated with flour, and deep-fried in a tempura style.
name: Restaurant Toyoken

detail_description: Kifune Castle, located near Kannawa in Beppu city, is a small but charming Japanese feudal castle that offers a unique experience for visitors. Reconstructed in 1957, the castle stands on a hill providing picturesque panoramic views of the city and the sea. Unlike typical Japanese castles, Kifune Castle has a distinctive religious atmosphere and features a hilltop garden and shrine inside the castle which can be accessed for a nominal fee.
name: Kifune Castle

detail_description: Mugen no Sato onsen is a one-day hot spring facility located in a serene mountain village, offering open-air baths surrounded by lush greenery. The milky blue water of the onsen is known for its relaxing and rejuvenating properties, with the color changing based on weather conditions. The sulfur water constantly replenishes as fresh onsen water flows into the pool.
name: Mugen no Sato onsen

detail_description: If you're in Beppu, make sure to check out Ikkyu no Namida for a modern dining experience with a rich culinary heritage. This eatery has been perfecting its recipes for three generations, and their special dashi broth is especially refreshing on a hot summer day. One of their specialties is the Beppu Reimen, featuring chewy buckwheat noodles in Japanese-style broth soup, topped with Chinese-style barbecued beef shank meat and sour cabbage kimchi.
name: Beppu local cold noodles IKKYU NO NAMIDA
address: ウエスティンやまなみビル 1F, 10 Chome-5-7 Ishigakinishi, Beppu, Oita 874-0910, Japan

detail_description: Hamawaki Onsen is one of the eight hot spring villages in Beppu Hatto, known for its diverse range of hot springs. This area offers a variety of options such as Kannawa Onsen, Alum hot spring, Kankaiji Hot Spring, Kamegawa Onsen, Shibaseki Hot Spring, and Horita Onsen. Visitors can indulge in different types of hot springs with unique characteristics and flavors while exploring the charm of Beppu Onsen.
name: Hamawaki Onsen

detail_description: The Statue of Aburaya Kumahachi is a bronze statue located just outside Beppu Station, making it hard to miss. Kumahachi Aburaya is known as the father of tourism in Beppu and played a significant role in promoting the sightseeing of Beppu Hot Spring. The statue depicts him descending from heaven with an angel by his side.
name: Statue of Aburaya Kumahachi

excerpt: Lush, volcanic peak with hiking & an animal park featuring wild macaques that live on the mountain.
detail_description: Takasakiyama, located just outside Beppu and technically part of Oita City, is a lush volcanic peak known for its large colony of Japanese macaques. The monkeys live in a natural state without cages, and visitors can observe them up close as they roam freely. Legend has it that being passed through by monkeys running to the feeding grounds brings good luck.
name: Takasakiyama

excerpt: Locals refer to this prominent stratovolcano, a local landmark for hiking, as Oita's Mt. Fuji.
detail_description: Mount Yufu, also known as Oita's Mt. Fuji, is a prominent stratovolcano and a local landmark for hiking. It is an extinct volcano with an interesting tale from ancient times when the area was once a lake. The goddess of Mount Yufu ordered the creation of a rift in the surrounding mountains to drain the area, leaving behind Lake Kinrin.
name: Mount Yufu

excerpt: Indoor & outdoor pools at a hot spring with high acidity levels near a volcano's steaming crater.
detail_description: Nestled in the mountains between Beppu and Yufuin, Tsukahara Onsen Kakono Izumi is a hot spring known for its high acidity levels, boasting a pH level of 1.4. Despite concerns about soaking in such acidic waters, it's perfectly safe and reputed to offer remarkable benefits for the skin. The onsen area also features indoor and outdoor pools with stunning views of the volcanic landscape.
name: Tsukahara Onsen Kakono Izumi

excerpt: Observation deck above a hot spring resort with clear views of steam rising from onsen bathhouses.
detail_description: Yukemuri Observation Deck offers a unique vantage point above a hot spring resort, providing clear views of steam rising from onsen bathhouses. Visitors can experience the beautiful sunset over the mountains of Kobe and watch ferries depart from the port for a 12-hour journey. The deck is an underrated spot with few visitors, allowing for a peaceful atmosphere to take in the steam emissions from various onsens and hotels in town.
name: Yukemuri Observation Deck

detail_description: Yunohana Hut 🛖 is a place where you can witness the traditional process of creating Yunohana, mineral encrustations formed by hot springs. This establishment has been using the same method since the Edo period and offers visitors a chance to observe the production for free. Additionally, Yunohana can be purchased as a popular souvenir. While visiting in summer may not be ideal due to high temperatures, autumn and winter offer an opportunity to experience their hot springs for a fee.
name: Yunohana-goya

excerpt: Popular lake featuring campgrounds, hiking trails, boat rentals & fishing in a tranquil setting.
detail_description: Nestled on a mountaintop at an elevation of 600 meters, Shidaka Lake has become a sought-after destination in recent years. The picturesque setting, surrounded by mountains and offering ever-changing seasonal scenery, from cherry blossoms to lush greenery and autumn foliage, makes it a unique camping spot. Visitors can bask in the tranquility of the lake's reflective surface under the open sky during the day and marvel at the starry night sky.
name: Shidaka Lake
address: 別府-4380-1 Higashiyama, Beppu, Oita 874-0000, Japan

detail_description: Murata TIMEHILLS is a picturesque resort nestled in the lush greenery of Japan's countryside. The resort offers a serene escape from the hustle and bustle of city life, with its tranquil atmosphere and stunning natural surroundings. Visitors can enjoy various outdoor activities such as hiking, cycling, and birdwatching, or simply relax and take in the breathtaking views. The accommodations are designed to provide comfort and luxury while blending seamlessly with the surrounding landscape.
name: Murata TIMEHILLS

detail_description: Yayoi Tengu is a charming shopping street known for its numerous hot springs, making it a perfect destination for a relaxing and enjoyable trip.
name: Yayoi Tengu

excerpt: Mountain hot springs site with a small petting zoo home to capybara, goats & peacocks.
detail_description: Yama Jigoku, also known as Mountain Hell, is a popular tourist destination featuring mountain hot springs and a small petting zoo with capybara, goats, and peacocks. The site offers various attractions such as foot baths, history exhibits, and an information center.
name: Yama Jigoku
address: 6組 鉄輪御幸, Beppu, Oita 874-0041, Japan

excerpt: Mountain viewpoint overlooking Beppu Bay, popular for evening vistas of the city lights below.
detail_description: Jumonji Viewpoint is one of the most popular attractions in Aomori. It offers a great view of the surrounding mountains and valleys.
name: Jumonji Viewpoint
address: 字池ノツル-1200 Noda, Beppu, Oita 874-0016, Japan

detail_description: The Catholic Church in Beppu is a charming place to visit. The choir's performance during the weekend mass was absolutely remarkable. This experience took place a few years ago in 2016, and if given the chance, I would definitely return. The church itself is an exquisite old building that holds daily Mass at 7 AM. You can access it through the rear entrance. It truly is an exceptionally beautiful place of worship in Beppu.
name: Beppu Catholic Church

detail_description: Mt. Ohira, a fan-shaped loose mountain located near Beppu Bay, offers breathtaking views and is a popular destination for many climbers. The summit provides an open vantage point to overlook the expansive Beppu Bay. To reach it, visitors can ascend from the Self-Defense Forces and make their way towards Myoban Onsen. Some choose to stay overnight at the nearby inn before returning, making it an ideal weekend getaway. Mt.
name: Mt. Ohira
